byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Yamiche Alcindor, Maggie Haberman, Jonathan Martin, Thomas Kaplan, Ashley Parker and Matt Flegenheimer.

abstract: Untimely demise of Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia is roiling already unpredictable presidential election into rare epic battle for control of every branch of government; contenders are stepping into fray in effort to rally their voters, with each side beginning to argue that opposing party's approach toward nomination is illegitimate.

headline.print_headline: Candidates Race to Draw Battle Lines Over a Surprise Vacancy
headline.main: With Death of Antonin Scalia, an Already Volatile Campaign Erupts

snippet: An unpredictable election that had pitted grass-roots activists against traditional party leaders is suddenly erupting into a rare battle royale for control of every branch of government.
lead_paragraph: An unpredictable election that had pitted grass-roots activists against traditional party leaders is suddenly erupting into a rare battle royale for control of every branch of government.
